message: Anyone else having problems creating apps at ep.io at the moment? A few hours ago I tried to deploy a Django project and it did not show up at the app's URL – http://chezmartina.ep.io/ («ep.io: Unknown app. It seems the URL you've used points to our servers, but we don't have a matching app to serve. We're terribly sorry about that.») . Now it seems that someone else's app («lessfuss») is running under my hostname. Then I tried the simple WSGI app example from the docs – uploading seems to work fine, but it won't show up at http://pbsimple.ep.io/ – instead «App not found» again. Anyone else experiencing similar problems?
Hm. Seems to be resolved now.
On a related note, we may move away from using haproxy alone for loadbalancing, but that's a whole part of a talk :)
Yes, this was related to our loadbalancer problems where haproxy wasn't reading the whole config file. We think we've fixed it now, but shout if something happens again.

@jdaguilera It's both their problem and hours; the config file is getting very long, and so it wasn't reloading fast enough. Don't worry - it's not critical (we've increased the reload delay), and we have a fix in the pipeline.
What are the reasons?  Is not functioning well? What are going to use instead??
I am not worried.  Just curious about the reasons and the new approach.  Tks for the answer.
No problem. Hopefully we can get a post up about how the new infrastructure works once it's in place.
That would be great.  Keep up the good work!
